A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This film\, at best\, is a bizarre disappointment; at worst\, it is an abysmal failure.  There are actually too many things to critique that I don't know where to start.  May be the fact that Finn and Rose's subplot is a pointless\, half-baked\, P.C. waste of time that has neither substance nor consequence; or maybe the fact that all the men are losers: Luke\, a cantankerous recluse\, Po\, an impertinent fool who needs to learn a "tough lesson\," Finn\, who cannot even succeed at dying for others.  Ben Solo had some good moments thanks to Adam Driver's excellent acting\, but his flip-flop conflict was a bit drawn out.

This movie also felt very preachy. Plutocracy is bad\, arm dealers are the greedy 1% . . . sure\, but why is this part of a Star Wars movie! Save it for a college classroom!  Not to mention the final message of Rose: We really win by loving one another instead of fighting our enemies.  What a false dichotomy!  This movie is called Star WARS . . it could have been called Star RETREATS.  The one offensive was in the opening film . . . an attack for which Po is harshly rebuked by Leia.  Every other engagement is called off\, abandoned\, or taken up by a force phantom.

Speaking of force phantoms\, what an ending: Don't worry everyone\, Luke didn't die! Yay!  . . . (30 seconds later) . . . oh . . . wait . . . he died\, nevermind. Well\, at least he didn't die fighting! That would have gone against our message.  Luke died . . . I died\, when I saw him being suckled by the Loch Ness monster.

All the mysteries and loose ends came to nothing: Rey's parents are nobodies\, Snoke dies and it never explains his backstory or how he seduced Ben Solo\, the knights of Ren are passed over\, etc.  

I could go on\, but what is the point! Critics who praised this movie not only do not know Star Wars\, they do not know good film-making! It is depressing enough that they want to distance this saga from the Skywalker family.  But more than this\, The Last Jedi is not a well-made film.  The plot\, the character arcs\, the dialogue . . . little of it is on point.  "Help us JJ Abrams . . . you're our only hope!"
